title: Conversion therapy: 'I thought God hated me because I was gay'
description: A Methodist minister tells of his struggle with sexuality and how he was sent for conversion therapy.

title: Wimbledon: How does tennis work when you're blind?
description: Wimbledon brings tennis to the spotlight every summer, though how does the sport work when you're blind?

title: Chris Mason: Why Labour's leader has made peace with Brexit
description: Sir Keir Starmer's vow to "make Brexit work" feels like a moment for Labour after years of argument.

title: Ian Poulter allowed to play Scottish Open after ban lifted - DP World Tour boss 'disappointed'
description: Ian Poulter will be allowed to play in this week's Scottish Open after an appeal against his ban is upheld, to the "disappointment" of DP World Tour.

title: Ukraine war: Putin presses on after Lysychansk capture
description: With Luhansk region entirely in Russia's hands, its president orders the offensive to be continued.

title: Minions: Cinemas ban teens in suits over #gentleminions trend
description: Young people following the #gentleminions TikTok trend are accused of disturbing others.

title: Big Zuu on breaking the mould for cookery shows
description: TV cook Big Zuu reflects on his Dave show's double Bafta win and the importance of representation.

title: Belgorod: Fear and denial in Russian city hit by shells
description: Residents of Belgorod are divided on how to respond to Ukraine after the city was hit by explosions.

title: F1 British Grand Prix: What is halo and how does it save lives?
description: Driver Zhou Guanyu says the halo device saved his life after a horror crash at Silverstone on Sunday.

title: Ukraine war: What is Putin's plan now Luhansk has fallen?
description: The fall of the city of Lysychansk means the whole Luhansk region is now under Russian control.

title: Commercial flight escorted by fighter jet after bomb hoax
description: A British holidaymaker was arrested after posting a bomb threat on social media.

title: Christian Eriksen: Denmark midfielder agrees in principle to join Manchester United
description: Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen agrees in principle to sign for Manchester United on a free transfer.

title: Copenhagen shooting: Harry Styles fans praise Danish police for attack response
description: People near the scene of Sunday's shooting say police did a good job in getting them to safety.

title: Fuel protests: Go-slow convoys cause motorway delays
description: Convoys of protesters are driving slowly on motorways as they call for fuel duty to be cut.

title: Copenhagen shooting: Gunman charged in court with murder
description: The suspect had mental health issues and there is no indication of a terror motive, police say.

title: Towie: Yazmin Oukhellou reportedly in hospital after crash which killed man
description: The Foreign Office says it is supporting the family of a British woman in hospital.

title: EasyJet deputy quits after major flight disruption
description: The move comes after the airline has been criticised for flight cancellations and disruption to schedules.

title: Bedford: Buildings evacuated as gas explosion wrecks flats
description: An eyewitness describes seeing a person leaping from a second-floor window to escape.

title: Tim Westwood: BBC reveals complaints against DJ
description: Police were involved after one of six bullying or sexual misconduct complaints, the corporation says.

title: Kellogg's loses court case over sugary cereal supermarket offers
description: It means products like Crunchy Nut Corn Flakes will not be allowed in end of aisle promotions.

title: Wireless Festival experience 'upsetting' for disabled fans
description: Wheelchair users were faced with steep hills and obscured views of the stage at the music festival.

title: The story behind Adele's Hyde Park Pride flag
description: Dean William was approached by one of the star's team before Saturday's sold-out BST Hyde Park gig.

title: Rescuers try to save stranded cargo ship near Sydney
description: Teams have been deployed to rescue a cargo ship that is stranded off the coast of Australia.

title: Marmolada glacier collapse in Italy kills six
description: Emergency officials said another nine people have been injured, and 19 remain missing.

title: School dinners: Beef off the menu as costs rise
description: Menus have fewer options and some schools are switching to cheaper meat from abroad, caterers say.

title: Barristers to strike every other week from August with no end date
description: The long-running dispute is over how much criminal barristers are paid for legal aid work.

title: Women's European Championship: Relive the best moment of Euro 2017
description: Watch the best moments from Euro 2017, including Jodie Taylor's opening-day hat-trick for England and Norway's shock win against Germany.

title: England v India: Stuart Broad told to 'shut up' by umpire
description: England's Stuart Broad is told to "shut up" by umpire Richard Kettleborough after one too many complaints during the rearranged fifth Test between England and India at Edgbaston.

title: China: Buyout of UK's largest microchip plant raises concerns
description: Welsh microchip producer has become a front-line in the tech war between the West and China.

title: Pink Ladies' Tractor Road Run helps breast cancer research
description: More than 100 women drive miles on decorated tractors on a journey to raise £1m for a cancer charity.

title: Jayland Walker: Ohio police release video of deadly suspect chase
description: Police say they believe Jayland Walker fired first before being shot more than 60 times by officers.

title: 'I use my eating disorder experience to help others'
description: Nicola Chan had non-purging bulimia and disordered eating, now she's helping others.

title: BBC pundits predict Euro 2022: Can England go all the way?
description: Who will win Euro 2022? Who will be the tournament's top goalscorer? Which team can cause an upset? BBC pundits predict what will happen at this summer's tournament.

title: Terrence Higgins: A name that gave hope to those with HIV and Aids
description: Higgins' friends talk about the man whose death was the catalyst for change for people with HIV.

title: Scientists discover new giant water lily species
description: Scientists discover the first new species of giant water lily in more than a century.
